intro: Harveya pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments. Harveya pulchra produces vibrant purple or red flowers that bloom in the spring. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
